column1: Kata Robata////Service:  5 stars.  Toddler friendly.  As we sat down
column3: the server asked if he should bring something out for the hungry little one.  Great idea.  The other day
column4: I gave them feedback about the freshness of an item.  The flavor was off.  You know
column5: like the way wine can be slightly off when going bad but still drinkable because it's not totally vinegar yet.  "Off"
column6: as in I've ate enough of it for so long (because it is my favorite) so I know how it's supposed to taste.  I insisted on paying for the dish (since I ate it anyway; I was hungry.  And it's sushi
column7: so it's bite size and it wasn't "off" enough to spit it out).  The manager absolutely insisted on taking it off the bill.  This went back and forth -- he won.
